neighbors.name: Anthony J. & Debra A. Hofmann
neighbors.claims: Debra A. Hofmann is listed as residing at 4705 E County Road 900 S in rural Cloverdale, Putnam County ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4705-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673519_zpid/)). Public records confirm the Hofmanns as local landowners, but no news articles or civic roles were found associated with them ([Putnam County Assessor](https://co.putnam.in.us/assessor)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners; no public roles noted

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate personal outreach to build rapport. Given the intense local opposition to the 4Leaf Solar project in Cloverdale, emphasize listening and transparency. Avoid assuming neutrality despite the lack of public statements.

citations.claim: Debra A. Hofmann is listed as residing at 4705 E County Road 900 S
citations.title: 4705 E County Road 900 S, Cloverdale, IN 46120

citations.claim: Public records confirm the Hofmanns as local landowners
citations.title: Putnam County Assessor Property Records

neighbors.name: Cynthia L. Ogborn
neighbors.claims: Cynthia L. “Cindy” Ogborn resides at 4690 E County Road 875 S in Cloverdale, Indiana ([Xome](https://www.xome.com/realestate/IN/Cloverdale/46120/County-Rd-750?page=7)). Her property spans roughly 12.7 acres with a home built in 1994 ([Realtor](https://www.realtor.com/propertyrecord-search/46120/E-County-Road-875-S)). While no direct civic role was found for Cynthia, a Brad Ogborn serves as Director of Transportation for the South Putnam Community School Corporation, suggesting potential family ties to local administration ([South Putnam Schools](https://www.sputnam.k12.in.us/staff)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Rural homeowner; possible school board tie

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Ms. Ogborn with respect for her long-term residency. Be aware of potential connections to the school district administration. Focus on how the project addresses concerns raised by the Putnam County Rural Preservation Society.

citations.title: Real Estate Records Cloverdale IN

neighbors.name: Jami K. & Richard “Shane” Cox
neighbors.claims: Jami K. Cox and her husband Richard “Shane” Cox are identified in county land records as co-owners of parcels in this part of Putnam County ([Putnam County Assessor](https://co.putnam.in.us/assessor)). Jami K. Cox is also listed as an owner of property on E Washington St in Greencastle ([Beacon](http://auditor.putnamcounty67.us/cgi.exe?CALL_PROGRAM=C009INFO&FINDINFO=00000013130&TAXYEAR=2024&ORIGIN=B)). No public commentary on development was found for this specific couple, though the name 'Shane Cox' appears in unrelated regional records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Cox family through a direct, informal introduction. Given the high solar opposition in Cloverdale, provide clear facts about setbacks and screening. Clarify if they reside at the rural parcel or the Greencastle address.

citations.claim: Identified in county land records as co-owners
citations.title: Putnam County Assessor Property Search

citations.claim: Jami K. Cox is also listed as an owner of property on E Washington St in Greencastle
citations.title: Putnam County Auditor Property Record 730 E Washington

neighbors.name: Michael E. Smith
neighbors.claims: Michael E. Smith is listed as the owner of the parcel at 4655 E County Road 900 S, Cloverdale, per property records ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4655-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673521_zpid/)). The property includes a home built in 1999 on approximately 2.5 acres ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4655-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673521_zpid/)). No public commentary or civic roles were found associated with this individual in Putnam County development hearings.

approach_recommendations.engage: Conduct low-key, personal outreach. Confirm if he is the primary resident. Be prepared to discuss visual screening, as the property is a smaller residential parcel (2.5 acres) likely sensitive to viewshed changes.
